pageContext.claim: “Study what General Pershing of the United States did to terrorists when caught. There was no more Radical Islamic Terror for 35 years!”
pageContext.analysis: The president repeats a myth that has long been debunked by historians. There is no evidence that Gen. John J. Pershing -- the only American general to receive six stars during his lifetime -- committed the war crime of shooting 50 Muslim terrorists after dipping the bullets in pig's blood. In fact, Pershing de-escalated the conflict because he found that escalating counterterrorism was ineffective during the Philippines insurgency in 1899-1913.
